description: Smallest prime that generates a prime pyramid of height n.
comments: Let p be prime; look for smallest prime that has previous term as a centered substring and has 2 more digits; repeat until no such prime can be found; then height(p) = number of rows in pyramid.a(13) > 10^10. [_Donovan Johnson_, Aug 13 2010]
links: H. Heinz, Patterns in Primes, Illustrating Two Prime Pyramids
Chai Wah Wu, On a conjecture regarding primality of numbers constructed from prepending and appending identical digits, arXiv:1503.08883 [math.NT], 2015.
author: _Felice Russo_, Jan 25 2000
